TopicTitle: I'm new - What Mods can work together for more parts?

Articles.Content:
I\'ve just started playing and would like to know what mods I can download so that I have more parts to play with?

Are there large part packs that play well with each other or some huge collection somewhere?

Thanks.

hi, welcome to the forums! there are lots of mod packs availible and most of them should be compatible. if you want heaps of more parts you should try the nova punch pack: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=4180.0

and for satelites and space stations you should try the Kosmos pack: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=7178.0 or Novasilisko\'s Bace pack and Probodobodyne both here: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6397.0

hope this helped!

I\'d recommend NovaPunch for sure, and it\'d be worth your time to checkout the C7 Flight/Aerospace packs. If you have the full game, make sure to visit the Plugins section, as there are many cool things there.

Mod compatibility is usually a non-issue, so you can stuff a ridiculous amount of parts into your KSP folder. In most cases, the only limit on the amount of parts you can have is your computer.

I thought some of these mods changed the default values of stock game parts?

I\'m having a hell of time figuring out how to even piece these Nova parts together.

I thought some of these mods changed the default values of stock game parts?

I\'m having a hell of time figuring out how to even piece these Nova parts together.

They don\'t change stock, they\'re just not necessarily balanced with stock.

Is NP the one with all the crazy decouplers and adapters? For those, you just slide the cone up until you shroud the engine, and it\'ll decouple nicely, but last time I checked, they\'re a bit wobbly.

I thought some of these mods changed the default values of stock game parts?

I\'m having a hell of time figuring out how to even piece these Nova parts together.

Only the old version of Silisko Edition (1.2) overwrites the default values. The new version (2.0 alpha 1) does not.
